revised_title: First Neutral-Beam Heating Experiments in JET: Advancements in Controlled Nuclear Fusion
tldr: The JET project successfully conducted the first neutral-beam heating experiments, achieving higher plasma density and energy confinement. The experiments extended the accessible density range by 70% above the ohmic limits, reaching ion temperatures of 4.8 and electron temperatures of 4.8. The neutral-beam heating technique is a significant step towards controlled nuclear fusion.
